benchmark_details.name: NOLIMA (Long-Context Evaluation Beyond Literal Matching)
benchmark_details.overview: NOLIMA introduces a benchmark extending the Needle-in-a-Haystack test by designing a needle set with minimal lexical overlap, requiring models to infer latent associations to locate answers in long irrelevant contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To design a high-challenge benchmark for evaluating large language models' reasoning capabilities in long context scenarios.

data.source: Open-license books prepared through application of filtering mechanisms.
data.annotation: Manually designed by authors to ensure minimal literal overlap.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the proportion of correct answers from multiple tests conducted under varying context lengths.
methodology.interpretation: Interpret results based on how well models generalize across increasing context lengths and the ability to reason through associative tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: The base scores achieved at shorter context lengths (1K, 2K) were used to evaluate performance declines at longer lengths.
methodology.validation: Results analyzed under controlled experiments with 7,540 tests per context length.
